snippet: Schools were closed and residents were hunkering down as heavy rain and wind began lashing the area as a storm moved down the coast.
abstract: Strongest storm in at least five years pushes across Northern California, flooding roads and towns, toppling trees and knocking out power to tens of thousands of homes and businesses; storm follows years in which San Francisco Bay Area residents have had to cope with severe drought.
lead_paragraph: Schools were closed and residents were hunkering down as heavy rain and wind began lashing the area as a storm moved down the coast.

headline.main: Rainstorm Turns the San Francisco Area From Arid to Soggy in Hours
headline.print_headline: Rainstorm Turns the San Francisco Area From Arid to Soggy in Hours
